title: Poster, "Many Gifts One Spirit for the Mennonite Central Committee", 1973
medium: Offset lithograph on white wove paper
inscribed:
Imprinted in black lower right corner: salt to the world in 1973 / 759 personal talents and $16,136,000 expended / in 57 countries.
Imprinted in black lower left: For current / service opportunities / write / Mennonite Central COmmittee / 21 S. 12th St. / Akron, Pennsylvania / 17501 / 337B - 41 Avenue N.E. / Calgary, Alberta / TZE 2N4 /   1009 Broadway / Saskatoon, Sask. S7N 1C1 / 101- 1483 Pembina Highway / Winnipeg, Manitoba / R3T 2C7 / Box 370 / Yarrow, B.C. / V0X ZA0 / or your Conference office.
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman
description: At upper left center a brown circle with a stylized dove motif is supperimposed on a photographic reproduction of a salt shaker. Small yellow dots scatter to the lower portion of the sheet. The words "many gifts- / one spirit" are in lower right quadrant. At lower right in red: agricultural / economic - technical / medical / social and / teaching services / in the name of Christ.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, "Many Gifts One Spirit for the Mennonite Central Committee", 1973.
1973. Offset lithograph on white wove paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-203.
